column1: 2 ^ Misericórdias Dòmini in aĕtèrnum cantábo~; in generatiónem et generatiónem adnuntiábo veritátem tuam in ore meo
column2: ^ The mercies of the Lord I will sing for ever~; I will show forth thy truth with my mouth to generation and generation

column1: 3 ^ qŭóniam dixìsti
column2: «~In aĕtèrnum misericórdia aĕdificábitur in caĕlîs.~»Praĕparábitur vèritas tua in eîs. ^ for thou hast said
column3: "Mercy shall be built up for ever in the heavens." Thy truth shall be prepared in them.

column1: 4 ^ «~Dispósui testamèntum elèctîs meîs
column2: jurávi Davídi servo meo
column3: ^ I have made a covenant with my elect~; I have sworn to David my servant

column1: 5 ^ ‹ Usque in aĕtèrnum praĕparábo semen tuum
column2: et aĕdificábo in generatiónem et generatiónem sedem tuam. ›~»^ 'Thy seed will I settle for ever
column3: and I will build up thy throne unto generation and generation.'"

column1: 6 ^ Confitebùntur caĕli mirabìlia tua
column2: Dòmine
column3: ètenim veritátem tuam in ecclésia sanctórum
column4: ^ The heavens shall confess thy wonders
column6: and thy truth in the church of the saints

column1: 7 ^ ¿~qŭóniam qŭìs in núbibus aĕquábitur Dòmino~; sìmilis èrit Deo in fíliîs Dei~? ^ for who in the clouds can be compared to the Lord~; who among the sons of God shall be like to God~?
8 ^ Deus
column2: qŭi glorificátur in consìlio sanctórum
column3: magnus et terrìbilis super omnes qŭi in circùmitu ejus sunt. ^ God
column4: who is glorified in the assembly of the saints
column5: great and terrible above all them that are about him.

column1: 9 ^ Dòmine Deus virtútum
column2: ¿~qŭìs sìmilis tìbi~? Potens ès
column3: Dòmine
column4: et vèritas tua in circùmitu tuo. ^ O Lord God of hosts
column5: who is like to thee~? Thou art mighty
column7: and thy truth is round about thee.

column1: 10 ^ Tu domináris potestáti maris~; motum aŭtem flùctuum ejus tu mítigas. ^ Thou rulest the power of the sea~; thou also appeasest the motion of the waves.
11 ^ Tu humiliavìsti sicut vulnerátum
column2: supèrbum~; in bráchio virtútis tuaĕ dispersìsti inimícos tuos. ^ Thou hast humbled the proud one
column3: as one that is slain~; with the arm of thy strength thou hast scattered thy enemies.

column1: 12 ^ Tui sunt caĕli
column2: et tua èst terra~; orbem terraĕ et plenitúdinem ejus tu fundavìsti. ^ Thine are the heavens
column3: and thine is the earth~; the world and the fulness thereof thou hast founded.

column1: 13 ^ Aquilónem et mare tu creavìsti~; Tabor et Hermon in nómine tuo exsultábunt. ^ The north and the sea thou hast created~; Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
14 ^ Tuum bráchium cum potèntia~; firmétur manus tua
column2: et exaltétur dèxtera tua. ^ Thy arm is with might~; let thy hand be strengthened
column3: and thy right hand exalted.

column1: 15 ^ Justìtia et judìcium praĕparátio sedis tuaĕ~; misericórdia et vèritas praĕcédent fáciem tuam. ^ Justice and judgment are the preparation of thy throne~; mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
16 ^ Beátus pòpulus qŭi scit jubilatiónem~; Dòmine
column2: in lúmine vultûs tui ambulábunt
column3: ^ Blessed is the people that knoweth jubilation~; O Lord
column4: they shall walk in the light of thy countenance

column1: 17 ^ et in nómine tuo exsultábunt tota die
column2: et in justìtia tua exaltabùntur
column3: ^ and in thy name they shall rejoice all the day
column4: and in thy justice they shall be exalted

column1: 18 ^ qŭóniam glória virtútis eórum tu ès
column2: et in beneplácito tuo exaltábitur cornu nostrum
column3: ^ for thou art the glory of their strength
column4: and in thy good pleasure shall our horn be exalted

column1: 19 ^ qŭia Dòmini èst assùmptio nostra
column2: et sancti Israhélis regis nostri. ^ for our protection is of the Lord
column3: and of our king the holy one of Israel.

column1: 20 ^ Tunc locútus ès in visióne sanctîs tuîs
column2: et dixìsti
column3: «~Pósui adjutórium in potente
column4: et exaltávi elèctum de plébe mea.~» ^ Then thou spokest in a vision to thy saints
column6: "I have laid help upon one that is mighty
column7: and have exalted one chosen out of my people."

column1: 21 ^ Invéni Davídem servum meum~; óleo sancto meo ûnxi eum. ^ I have found David my servant~; with my holy oil I have anointed him.
22 ^ Manus enim mea aŭxiliábitur ei
column2: et bráchium meum confortábit eum. ^ For my hand shall help him
column3: and my arm shall strengthen him.

column1: 23 ^ Nihil profìciet inimícus in eo
column2: et fílius iniqŭitátis non appónet nocére ei. ^ The enemy shall have no advantage over him
column3: nor the son of iniquity have power to hurt him.

column1: 24 ^ Et concáĕdem a fácie ipsíus inimícos ejus
column2: et odièntes eum in fugam convèrtem. ^ And I will cut down his enemies before his face
column3: and them that hate him I will put to flight.

column1: 25 ^ Et vèritas mea et misericórdia mea cum ipso
column2: et in nómine meo exaltábitur cornu ejus. ^ And my truth and my mercy shall be with him
column3: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

column1: 26 ^ Et ponem in mari manum ejus
column2: et in flumìnibus dèxteram ejus. ^ And I will set his hand in the sea
column3: and his right hand in the rivers.

column1: 27 ^ Ipse invocábit me
column2: «~Pater meus ès tu
column3: Deus meus
column4: et suscèptor salútis meaĕ.~»^ He shall cry out to me
column7: and the support of my salvation."

column1: 28 ^ Et ego primogènitum ponem illum
column2: excèlsum praĕ régibus terraĕ. ^ And I will make him my firstborn
column3: high above the kings of the earth.

column1: 29 ^ In aĕtèrnum servábo illi misericórdiam meam
column2: et testamèntum meum fidéle ipsi. ^ I will keep my mercy for him for ever
column3: and my covenant faithful to him.

column1: 30 ^ Et ponem in sáĕculum sáĕculi semen ejus
column2: et tronum ejus sicut dies caĕli. ^ And I will make his seed to endure for evermore
column3: and his throne as the days of heaven.

column1: 31 ^ Si aŭtem derelíqŭerint fílii ejus legem meam
column2: et in judìciîs meîs non ambuláverint
column3: ^ If his children forsake my law
column4: and walk not in my judgments

column1: 32 ^ si justìtias meas profanáverint
column2: et mandáta mea non custodíverint
column3: ^ if they profane my justices

column1: 33 ^ visitábo in virga iniqŭitátes eórum
column2: et in verbèribus peccáta eórum. ^ I will visit their iniquities with a rod
column3: and their sins with stripes.

column1: 34 ^ Misericórdiam aŭtem meam non dispèrgem ab eo
column2: nèqŭe nocébo in veritáte mea
column3: ^ But my mercy I will not take away from him
column4: nor will I suffer my truth to fail.

column1: 35 ^ nèqŭe profanábo testamèntum meum
column2: et qŭaĕ procédunt de lábiîs meîs non faciam ìrrita. ^ Neither will I profane my covenant
column3: and the words that proceed from my mouth I will not make void.

column1: 36 ^ Semel jurávi in sancto meo
column2: si Davídi mèntier~; ^ Once have I sworn by my holiness
column3: if I will lie unto David~;

column1: 37 ^ semen ejus in aĕtèrnum manébit
column2: et tronus ejus sicut sol in conspèctu meo
column3: ^ his seed shall endure for ever
column4: and his throne as the sun before me

column1: 38 ^ et sicut luna perfecta in aĕtèrnum
column2: et tèstis in caĕlo fidélis. ^ and as the moon perfect for ever
column3: and a faithful witness in heaven.

column1: 39 ^ Tu vero repulìsti et despexìsti~; distulìsti christum tuum. ^ But thou hast rejected and despised~; thou hast been angry with my anointed.
40 ^ Evertìsti testamèntum servi tui~; profanavìsti in terra sanctuárium ejus. ^ Thou hast overthrown the covenant of thy servant~; thou hast profaned his sanctuary on the earth.
41 ^ Destruxìsti omnes sepes ejus~; posuìsti firmamèntum ejus formídinem. ^ Thou hast broken down all his hedges~; thou hast made his strength fear.
42 ^ Diripuérunt eum omnes transièntes viam~; factus èst oppróbrium vicínîs suîs. ^ All that pass by the way have robbed him~; he is become a reproach to his neighbours.
43 ^ Exaltavìsti dèxteram deprimèntium eum~; laĕtificavìsti omnes inimícos ejus. ^ Thou hast set up the right hand of them that oppress him~; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
44 ^ Avertìsti adjutórium gládii ejus
column2: et non ès aŭxiliátus ei in bello. ^ Thou hast turned away the help of his sword
column3: and hast not assisted him in battle.

column1: 45 ^ Destruxìsti eum ab emundatióne
column2: et sedem ejus in terram collisìsti. ^ Thou hast made his purification to cease
column3: and thou hast cast his throne down to the ground.

column1: 46 ^ Minoravìsti dies tèmporis ejus~; perfudìsti eum confusióne. ^ Thou hast shortened the days of his time~; thou hast covered him with confusion.
47 ^ ¿~Úsquequo
column2: Dòmine
column3: avèrtis in finem~? ¿~Exardéscet sicut ignis ira tua~? ^ How long
column5: turnest thou away unto the end~? Shall thy anger burn like fire~?

column1: 48 ^ Memoráre qŭaĕ mea substántia~; ¿~numqŭid enim vane constituvìsti omnes fílios hòminum~? ^ Remember what my substance is~; for hast thou constituted all the children of men in vain~?
49 ^ ¿~Qŭìs èst hòmo qŭi vivet et non vǐdébit mortem
column2: éruet ánimam suam de manu ìnferi~? ^ Who is the man that shall live and not see death
column3: that shall deliver his soul from the hand of hell~?

column1: 50 ^ ¿~Ubi sunt misericórdiaĕ tuaĕ antíqŭaĕ
column2: Dòmine
column3: sicut juravìsti Davídi in veritáte tua~? ^ Where are thy ancient mercies
column5: according to what thou didst swear to David in thy truth~?

column1: 51 ^ Mèmor èsto
column2: Dòmine
column3: oppróbrii servórum tuórum
column8: of the reproach of thy servants
column9: which I have held in my bosom

column1: 52 ^ qŭod exprobravérunt inimíci tui
column2: Dòmine
column3: qŭod exprobravérunt commûtátionem christi tui. ^ Wherewith thy enemies have reproached
column5: wherewith they have reproached the change of thy anointed.

column1: 53 ^ Benedìctus Dòminus in aĕtèrnum. Fiat
column2: fiat. ^ Blessed be the Lord for evermore. So be it
column3: so be it.
